newsitem.title: USA: PC-Quote to sell non-Internet business.
newsitem.headline: PC-Quote to sell non-Internet business.

text.p: PC Quote Inc said Friday it entered into a non-binding letter of intent to sell its non-Internet-based quotation business to Track Data Corp.
PC Quote said the sale is the first of several strategic moves the company will undertake to further emphasize its Internet-based business.

The letter of intent contemplates a sale price of up to 750,000 shares of Track Data common stock and contingent cash payments of up to 50 percent of pre-tax earnings of the acquired business for a period of three years.

In addition, Track Data will assume certain liabilities connected with the business. The transaction is subject to board approvals, the satisfactory completion of due diligence and execution of a definitive purchase agreement.
PC Quote said the annual revenues from the business to be sold amounts to $10 million.
Under the terms of the agreement, PC Quote retains the rights to use its HyperFeed digital feeds of stock prices and financial market information available, to power its Internet/Intranet products.
Louis Morgan, PC Quote chairman, said the deal would allow it to focus on reducing costs and enhancing its rapidly growing Internet business.

"We currently have four successful Internet initiatives with more to come," Morgan said. "At the same time, our traditional business will be in good hands at Track Data Corp, which already has all of the necessary infrastructure in place."
Track Data provides real-time financial market data, fundamental research, charting and analytical services to both institutional and individual investors.
PC Quote provides on-line stock and market quotes.
